text.title: Be As a City Upon a Hill

head.s: Be As a City Upon a Hill

p.s: For we must consider that we shall be as a city upon a hill .

The eyes of all people are upon us , so that if we shall deal falsely with our God in this work we have undertaken , and so cause Him to withdraw His present help from us , we shall be made a story and a by-word through the world .
" -- John Winthrop , " A Model of Christian Charity "

item.s: Show mercy and justice in equal parts .
Sometimes there may be an occasion of showing mercy to a rich man in some sudden danger of distress , and also doing a mere justice o a poor man in regard of some particular contract . .
First , accept that every man afford his help to another in every want or distress .
Second , that he perfomed this out of the same affection which makes him careful of his own goods , according to that of our Savior .
Give .
If the time and occasion are extraordinary , give out in abundance .
If the time and occasion are extraordinary , be ruled by them .
Lend .
Observe whether or not the recipient has present , probable , or possible means of repaying you .
If he does not , then give him according to his necessity rather than lend him as he requires .
If he has means of repaying you , do not look at the act as a mercy , but a way of commerce in which you are ruled by justice .
Forgive .
Whether you lended as an act of mercy or as a way of commerce , you must forgive him regardless of whether or not he repays you .
Love .
The love among Christians is a real thing , not imaginary .
This love is as absolutely necessary to the being of the body of Christ as the sinews adn other ligaments of a nutural body are to teh being of that body .
This love is divine , spiritual nature free , active , strong , courageous , permanent .
Undervaluing all things beneath its proper object .
Of all the graces , this makes us nearer to resemble the virtues of our Heavenly Father .
Accept that God Almighty hath ordained the condition of mankind : That some must be rich , some poor , some high and powerful , others low and subjected .

Through this , you will be able to acknowledge that : See the glory of His wisdom in the variety and difference of the creatures , and the glory of His power , in ordering all these differences for the preservation and good of the whole .
See that He might have the more occasion to manifest the work of His Spirit upon teh wicked in moderating and restraining them .
See that every man might have need of others , and from hence they might al be knit more nearly together in the bonds of brotherly affection .
Know the proper time and place to sell all and give to the poor .
Know the proper time to give beyond your ability .
Know the proper time to unite with the community in some special service for the Church .
Know the proper time to help anyone in distress beyond your ability , rather than tempt God in putting him upon help by miraculous and extraordinary means
